api.name: beam_participant
api.description: Represents a user who is currently viewing a Beam Interactive stream. This user (also known as a beam_participant) can have both a Beam account and a Microsoft Security Account (MSA).

methods.description: Returns the Beam ID of the user.
methods.name: beam_id()
methods.return_description: The Beam ID of the user.

methods.description: Returns the Beam username of the user.
methods.name: beam_username()
methods.return_description: The Beam username of the user.

methods.description: Returns the Beam level of the user.
methods.name: beam_level()
methods.return_description: The Beam level of the user.

methods.description: Returns the current state of the participant.
methods.name: state()
methods.return_description: The current state of the participant.

methods.description: Returns the time (in UTC) at which the user last used the interactive control input.
methods.name: lastInputAt()
methods.return_description: The time (in UTC) at which the user last used the interactive control input.

methods.description: Returns the time (in UTC) at which the user connected to the Beam Interactive stream.
methods.name: connectedAt()
methods.return_description: The time (in UTC) at which the user connected to the Beam Interactive stream.

methods.description: Returns a value that indicates whether or not the user input is disabled. If TRUE, user input has been disabled.
methods.name: input_disabled()
methods.return_description: Boolean value that indicates whether or not the user input is disabled.

methods.description: Returns an array of controls triggered by the participant.
methods.name: controls()
methods.return_description: An array of controls triggered by the participant.

methods.description: Returns an array of buttons clicked by the participant.
methods.name: buttons()
methods.return_description: An array of buttons clicked by the participant.

methods.description: Returns an array of joysticks used by the participant.
methods.name: joysticks()
methods.return_description: An array of joysticks used by the participant.

api.name: beam_scene
api.description: Represents a Beam Interactive scene. These scenes are configured using the Beam Lab.

methods.description: Returns the unique string identifier for the scene.
methods.name: scene_id()
methods.return_description: The unique string identifier for the scene.

methods.description: Returns a value that indicates whether the scene is enabled or disabled. If the value is TRUE, the scene is enabled. Note that a scene can be an active but disabled. This means that users are unable to interact with the controls in the scene because all controls have been disabled.
methods.name: enabled()
methods.return_description: Boolean value that indicates whether this scene is enabled or disabled.

methods.description: Function to enable or disable the scene.
methods.name: set_enabled(_In_ const bool is_enabled)

params.param_description: Value to enable or disable the scene. Set this value to TRUE to enable the scene.

methods.description: Returns a value that indicates whether or not this is the current scene that is being displayed to Beam participants.
methods.name: is_current()
methods.return_description: Boolean value that indicates whether this is the current scene that is being displayed.

methods.description: Returns the array of controls in the scene.
methods.name: controls()
methods.return_description: An array of controls in the scene.

methods.description: Returns the pointer to the specified control, if it exist.
methods.name: control(_In_ const string_t&)

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the control.

methods.return_description: The pointer to the specified control.

methods.description: Returns the pointer to the specified button control, if it exist.
methods.name: button(_In_ const string_t&)

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the control.

methods.return_description: The pointer to the specified button control.

methods.description: Returns the pointer to the specified joystick, if it exist.
methods.name: joystick(_In_ const string_t&)

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the joystick.

methods.return_description: The pointer to the specified joystick.

api.name: beam_manager
api.description: The manager service class that handles the Beam Interactive event experience between Beam service and the title.

methods.description: Returns the singleton instance of the Beam manager.
methods.name: get_singleton_instance()
methods.return_description: The singleton instance of the Beam manager.

methods.code: bool initialize(_In_ const string_t& accessToken, _In_ const string_t& refreshToken, _In_ const string_t& interactiveVersion, _In_ const string_t& initialSceneId, _In_ bool goInteractive)
methods.description: Sets up the connection for the Beam Interactive event experience by initializing a background task.
methods.name: initialize(_In_ const string_t&, _In_ const string_t&, _In_ const string_t&, _In_ const string_t&, _In_ bool)

params.param_description: The OAuth access token granted for this Beam account.
The OAuth refresh token granted for this Beam account.
The version of the Beam Interactive experience created for the title.
The unique identifier of the initial scene. If value is not set, the configured default scene is used.
Value that indicates whether or not to start interactivity immediately. If TRUE, after initialization and it enters interactivity.

methods.return_description: Value that indicates whether the initialization request is accepted or not. If TRUE, the initialization request is accepted.

methods.description: Returns the channel ID of the streamer who is broadcasting and receiving interactive input.
methods.name: channel_id()
methods.return_description: The channel ID of the steamer.

methods.description: Returns the version of the Beam Interactive experience created for this title.
methods.name: interactive_version()
methods.return_description: The version of the experience.

methods.description: Returns the Xbox app ID associated with the title.
methods.name: app_id()
methods.return_description: The Xbox app ID.

methods.description: Returns the value to indicate the interactive state of the Beam manager.
methods.name: interactivity_state()
methods.return_description: Value that indicates the interactive state.

methods.description: Used by the title to inform the Beam service that it is ready to receive interactive input.
methods.name: start_interactive()
methods.return_description: The Beam event.

methods.description: Used by the title to inform the Beam service that it is no longer receiving interactive input.
methods.name: stop_interactive()
methods.return_description: The Beam event.

methods.description: Returns currently active participants of this interactive experience.
methods.name: participants()
methods.return_description: All currently active Beam participants.

methods.description: Gets all the scenes associated with the current interactive instance.
methods.name: scenes()
methods.return_description: All scenes associated with the current interactive instance.

methods.description: Gets all the controls associated with the current interactive instance.
methods.name: controls()
methods.return_description: All the controls associated with the current interactive instance.

methods.description: Gets all of the buttons associated with the current interactive instance.
methods.name: buttons()
methods.return_description: All the buttons associated with the current interactive instance.

methods.description: Gets all of the joysticks associated with the current interactive instance.
methods.name: joysticks()
methods.return_description: All the joysticks associated with the current interactive instance.

methods.description: Sets a particular scene as the current interactive scene.
methods.name: set_current_scene(_In_ const string_t&)

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the scene to be set.

methods.description: Gets the current interactive scene.
methods.name: current_scene()
methods.return_description: The current interactive scene.

methods.description: Manages and maintains proper state updates between the title and the Beam Service. To ensure best performance, do_work() must be called frequently, such as once per frame. Title needs to be thread safe when calling do_work() since this is when states are changed. This also clears the state of the input controls.
methods.name: do_work()
methods.return_description: A list of all the events the title has to handle. Empty if no events have been triggered during this update.

api.name: beam_event
api.description: Base class for all Beam Interactive events. Beam Interactive is an event-driven service.

constructor_class.code: beam_event(_In_ std::chrono::milliseconds time, _In_ std::error_code errorCode, _In_ std::string errorMessage, _In_ beam_event_type eventType, _In_ std::shared_ptr<beam_event_args> eventArgs)
constructor_class.name: beam_event()

methods.description: Returns the time (in UTC) when this event is raised.
methods.name: time()
methods.return_description: The time (in UTC).

methods.description: Returns the error code indicating the result of the operation.
methods.name: err()
methods.return_description: The error code.

methods.description: Returns a call specific error message with debug information. Message is not localized as it is meant to be used for debugging only.
methods.name: err_message()
methods.return_description: The error message.

methods.description: Returns the type of the event raised.
methods.name: event_type()
methods.return_description: The Beam event type.

methods.description: Returns a list of event arguments. Cast each event arg to a specific event arg class type before retrieving the data.
methods.name: event_args()
methods.return_description: A list of event args.

api.name: beam_event_args
api.description: Base class for all Beam event args. Contains information for Beam Interactive events.

constructor_class.description: Creates the Beam event args class.
constructor_class.name: beam_event_args()

destructor_class.description: Destroys the Beam event args instance.
destructor_class.name: ~beam_event_args()

api.name: beam_participant_state_change_event_args
api.description: Contains information for a participant state change event. The state changes when a participant joins or leaves the channel.

methods.description: Returns the beam_participant object of the user whose state has changed.
methods.name: participant()
methods.return_description: The Beam participant.

methods.description: Returns the current state of the participant.
methods.name: state()
methods.return_description: The current state of the participant.

api.name: beam_button_event_args
api.description: Contains information for a button event.

constructor_class.description: Creates the Beam button event args class.
constructor_class.name: beam_button_event_args()

methods.description: Returns the unique string identifier for this control.
methods.name: control_id()
methods.return_description: The unique string identifier for this control.

methods.description: Returns the user who triggered this event.
methods.name: participant()
methods.return_description: The user who triggered this event.

methods.description: Boolean to indicate if the button is up or down. Returns TRUE if button is down.
methods.name: is_pressed()
methods.return_description: The value that indicates whether the button is down or not.

api.name: beam_joystick_event_args
api.description: Contains information for a joystick event. These arguments are sent at an interval frequency configured via the Beam Lab.

constructor_class.description: Creates the Beam joystick event args class.
constructor_class.name: beam_joystick_event_args()

methods.description: Returns the unique string identifier for this control.
methods.name: control_id()
methods.return_description: The unique string identifier for this control.

methods.description: Returns the X coordinate of the joystick, in the range of [-1, 1].
methods.name: x()
methods.return_description: The X coordinate of the joystick.

methods.description: Returns the Y coordinate of the joystick, in the range of [-1, 1].
methods.name: y()
methods.return_description: The Y coordinate of the joystick.

methods.description: Returns the intensity value at which the joystick is pushed. This value which has a range of [0, 1.0] determines how the ring around the joystick control is rendered on screen. If this value is set to 1.0, the "halo" effect around the joystick control is at its brightest. This value can be used to represent the relative agreement of the inputs from all the Beam participants.
methods.name: intensity()
methods.return_description: The intensity value at which the joystick is pushed.

methods.description: Returns the user who triggered this event.
methods.name: participant()
methods.return_description: The user who triggered this event.

api.name: beam_control
api.description: Base class for all Beam Interactive controls. All controls are created and configured using the Beam Lab.

methods.description: Returns the unique string identifier for this control.
methods.name: control_id()
methods.return_description: The unique string identifier for this control.

methods.description: Returns the value that indicates whether the control is enabled or disabled.
methods.name: enabled()
methods.return_description: Value that indicates whether the control is enabled or disabled.

methods.description: Returns the help text that displays when a Beam participant hovers over the control.
methods.name: help_text()
methods.return_description: The help text.

methods.description: This method must be called to indicate that this control has been triggered. Controls can be configured to trigger a variety of actions, including rendering visual effects on screen. Actions triggered are authored through the Beam Lab.
methods.name: set_fired()

methods.description: Function to enable or disable this control.
methods.name: set_enabled(_In_ const bool)

params.param_description: Value to enable or disable the control. Set this value to TRUE to enable the control.

api.name: beam_button_control
api.description: Represents a Beam Interactive button control. This class is derived from beam_control. All controls are created and configured using the Beam Lab.

methods.description: Returns the text displayed on this button control.
methods.name: button_text()
methods.return_description: The text displayed on this button control.

methods.description: Returns the spark cost assigned to this button control.
methods.name: cost()
methods.return_description: The spark cost.

methods.description: Sets cooldown duration (in milliseconds) required between triggers
methods.name: trigger_cooldown(const std::chrono::milliseconds&)

params.param_description: Cooldown duration (in milliseconds).

methods.description: Returns the time remaining (in milliseconds) before this button can be triggered again.
methods.name: remaining_cooldown()
methods.return_description: The time remaining (in milliseconds).

methods.description: Returns the current progress of this button control.
methods.name: progress()
methods.return_description: Current progress.

methods.description: Sets the progress value for this button control.
methods.name: set_progress(_In_ const float&)

params.param_description: The progress value.

methods.description: Returns the total number of button down events since the last call to do_work().
methods.name: count_of_button_downs()
methods.return_description: The number of button down events.

methods.description: Returns the total number of button down events by the specified participant since the last call to do_work().
methods.name: count_of_button_downs(_In_ const string_t& beamId)

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the Beam participant.

methods.description: Returns the total number of button presses since the last call to do_work().
methods.name: count_of_button_presses()
methods.return_description: The number of button presses.

methods.description: Returns the total number of button presses by the specified participant since the last call to do_work().
methods.name: count_of_button_presses(_In_ const string_t&)

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the Beam participant.

methods.description: Returns the total number of button up events since the last call to do_work().
methods.name: count_of_button_ups()
methods.return_description: The number of button ups.

methods.description: Returns the total number of button up events triggered by the specified participant since the last call to do_work().
methods.name: count_of_button_ups(_In_ const string_t&)

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the Beam participant.

methods.description: Returns TRUE if button is currently pressed.
methods.name: button_pressed()
methods.return_description: Value that indicates if the button is pressed or not.

methods.description: Returns TRUE if the button is currently clicked by the specified participant.
methods.name: button_pressed(_In_ const uint32_t&)

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the Beam participant.

methods.description: Returns TRUE if button is currently down.
methods.name: button_down()
methods.return_description: Value that indicates if the button is down or not.

methods.description: Returns TRUE if the button is currently clicked by the specified participant.
methods.name: button_down(_In_ const uint32_t&)

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the Beam participant.

methods.description: Returns TRUE if button is currently up.
methods.name: button_up()
methods.return_description: Value that indicates if the button is up or not.

methods.description: Returns TRUE if the button is currently not clicked by the specified participant.
methods.name: button_up(_In_ const uint32_t&)

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the Beam participant.

api.name: beam_joystick_control
api.description: Represents a Beam Interactive joystick control. This class is derived from beam_control. All controls are created and configured using the Beam Lab.

methods.description: Returns the current X coordinate of the joystick, in the range of [-1, 1]
methods.name: x()
methods.return_description: The current X coordinate.

methods.description: Returns the current Y coordinate of the joystick, in the range of [-1, 1]
methods.name: y()
methods.return_description: The current Y coordinate.

methods.code: void set_coordinates(_In_ const double& x, _In_ const double& y)
methods.description: Sets the joystick coordinates for this control. This can be used to set the coordinates to an average value. The average value is obtained by using the values provided by all connected beam_spectators through incoming events.
methods.name: set_coordinates(_In_ const double&, _In_ const double&)

params.param_description: The X coordinate, in the range of -1.0 to 1.0.
The Y coordinate, in the range of -1.0 to 1.0.

methods.code: const void set_intensity(_In_ const double& intensity)
methods.description: Sets the intensity value of the joystick control.
methods.name: set_intensity(_In_ const double&)

params.param_description: The intensity value, in the range of 0.0 to 1.0.

api.name: beam_event_type
api.description: Describes the types of Beam events.

enums.name: error
enums.description: This event is raised when the service or manager encounters an error. The err and err_message members will contain pertinent info.

enums.name: interactivity_initialized
enums.description: This event is raised when interactivity has been initialized.

enums.name: interactivity_started
enums.description: This event is raised when the interactive session is acknowledged by the server.

enums.name: interactivity_stopped
enums.description: This event is raised when the interactive session is stopped.

enums.name: participant_state_changed
enums.description: This event is raised when a participant's state has changed.

enums.name: control
enums.description: This event is raised when a control is used.

api.name: beam_interactivity_state
api.description: Describes the current state of the interactive service.

enums.name: not_initialized
enums.description: The Beam manager is not initalized.

enums.name: not_interactive
enums.description: The Beam manager is initialized, but interactivity is not enabled.

enums.name: interactive_pending
enums.description: Currently connecting to the Beam interactive service.

api.name: beam_participant_state
api.description: Describes the current state of the participant.
